data.title: Can't format typescript code with tabs (latest insider build)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.6.0-insider (1dccf027b24d3b83f471c3cc9d938af6c27e764e, 2016-09-27T06:09:54.324Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14931

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open any of .ts file, that already uses tabs for indentation
2. Choose «Format Code (Alt Shift F)»

Expected behaviour: code must be formatted using tabs
Actual behaviour: spaces are used instead of tabs

GIF: http://i.imgur.com/qW3mBaF.gifv

data.title: Debug Map: weird value changed indication
Allow dragging extension from the extension viewlet into the extensions.json file
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.0 - Insider
- OS Version: Windows

Dragging an extension would be cool to add it to the extensions.json. Even copy & paste would help. I now have to know the id which is hard to find and copy. The only place I found for the id was the URL in the browser.

data.title: Global search stops working after a while
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.6 (El Capitan)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open search sidebar
2. Enter search term
3. do a search

Sometimes vscode will do a search, you can see the progress bar progressing, but then it stops about 10 pixels before the end and no results show up. If I restart vscode and perform the same search again it finds things just fine.

I've also noticed that search is really slow in general (I have a beefy mac book pro), which is really annoying with quick open (`cmd+p`) as it can take more than half a minute to find a file that way. Even if I type in the exact filename (sublimetext is instantaneous on the same project (with less folders excluded) and I feel it does better fuzzy matching).

Our project is relatively big, but I've excluded almost everything so I'm only dealing with about 3000 files (mix of JS, python, java, protobufs, less, images, etc).

Happy to provide more details if you need them.

data.title: Goto line with relative line numbers renders wrong lines

data.body:

1. enable relative line numbers
2. go to the end of a big file
3. Ctrl+G
4. type 8

data.title: Code complete in empty extensions.json not very helpful
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Create empty recommendation file
2.  Activate code complete
3. You get

![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1931590/18869607/584e580a-84ad-11e6-9b0b-c33597f9b416.png)

We should either show proper code assist or put an example in as a comment. Only having the link to the documentation is not very useful.

I know that the json schema supports snippets. So we can add a snippet as well for a 'default' extension

data.title: Suggestion: add more files to integrity check
data.body:
For https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/12659

I suggest to add `vs\workbench\electron-browser\bootstrap\index.html` and `vs\workbench\electron-browser\bootstrap\index.js` to the checks because it would make it harder for someone to inject JS/CSS into the workbench doing so.

data.title: launch-config should allow me reference any command
data.body:
I wanna write an extension that is a set of commands for asking for user input, like _input text_, _make selection_ etc. Then I want to use commands from that extension in our launch.config - my ultimate goal is support `mocha -g "test name"` from within VS Code. 

I have modified our [launch.json](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/.vscode/launch.json#L13) so

```
        "args": [
                "--timeout",
                "999999",
                "-g",
                "${command.inputs.text}"
            ]
```

and an extension that contributes a `inputs.text` command and that activates on that command

```
// extension.js
vscode.commands.registerCommand('inputs.text', function () { ... });

// package.json
 "activationEvents": [
     "onCommand:inputs.text"
 ]
```

This doesn't work and it requires me to also define a debugger which I believe is unnecessary complicated.

some time files code will become same
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.5.3 (5be4091987a98e3870d89d630eb87be6d9bafd27, 2016-09-22T08:50:42.185Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601

Steps to Reproduce:
1. open two files swap multiple time and change some code 
2. you will find the same code in both the file even if you close file and open again it will refer the existing open file code.
3. currently we are closing the application and opening again then it is working fine
4. This is happening so may time getting irritate because suddenly your code will be same in both the files.

data.title: "editor.lineNumbers" should use "on", "off", and "relative" instead of false, true, "relative"
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.0 Insiders
- OS Version: Windows

The old values should still be supported, however we should offer on off as well. When you have relative as a value it is more natural to change it to a string value than to a Boolean.

data.title: Inconsistent loading feedback
data.body:
The hover loading indication is the trustworthy _Loading..._ label while IntelliSense shows a flashy animation of chasing dots. Both should be aligned - and yes, my preference would be the `Loading...` label because it's less nervous.

![sep-27-2016 10-33-45](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1794099/18865960/11025d98-849e-11e6-9caa-4ed49d97e00a.gif)

data.title: VScode does not run/load without internet. New window crashes when No connectivity.
data.body:

- OS Version: Windows-7 Professional

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Open VScode without Internet connectivity.(No wifi or Lan connectivity). It does not run.
2.  Open VScode, disable lan connectivity. Open new VScode window (Ctrl+shift+N). VScode crashes.
   ![vscode_crash](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13175348/18865914/3f5528b6-84bb-11e6-886c-f16cec662610.jpg)

data.title: watermarks should be more interactive
data.body:
- the titles, like 'Toggle Terminal' should be links that execute the command
- add a way to configure the keybindings, e.g. make the keybindings text a link

data.title: Format on Save must be guarded
data.body: today format on save runs in the main thread which is bad because it's under the radar of your constraints and guards

data.title: Info message about `typescript.tsdk` is a bit too much
data.body:
I see the current conundrum about TS 2.0, but the current product state shows a bit too much of info popups and notifications.

I understand the need for showing a popup asking the user to choose between the workspace and the shipped version of TypeScript, if different.

But the following preemptive one is too much in your face. Users that already use TypeScript very likely already have it in their `node_modules`, and will get the aforementioned popup. And brand new VS Code users will be greeted with this popup on their first TypeScript experience.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/18864734/eb16df92-8497-11e6-80d0-3e0c7ca23769.png)

data.title: Impossible to launch the React Native Debuguer

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
## Actual Behavior

When I want to run the debuger I got "Le processus de l'adaptateur de débogage s'est terminé de manière inattendue" "Ouvrir launch.json"
## Expected Behavior

I want the debuger to be launched!
## Software versions

React-Native VS Code extension version: React Native Tools 0.2.0
VSCode version: Version 1.5.3 (1.5.3)
OS platform and version: macOS 10.11.6
React Native version: RN 0.33

data.title: Drag selected text to move it
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Windows 8.1 Enterprise 64-bit

Steps to Reproduce:

Please enable drag selected text to move it (See this: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/33858029)
For exmaple this feature is in notepad++.
